intro: Lycianthes amatitlanensis, commonly known as the Amatitlán beauty, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers and oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated for its vibrant blooms.
